regex.info: Website that will be used when the user will click on a valid IP address.  This site will provide extra informations about the IP localisation and owner

output.info: [settings][output][hide] will be used to remove unnecessary fields before outputting the log entry.  For instance, mention 'identUser' if you don't need this information on the output.   Aim : display only valuable informations

monitored_info: Each request to one of these url will be reported so you can verify who (IP) make a connection on these urls.

simplify_urls.info: These parameters, if found in the URL, will be removed, before starting the analyse.

regex.(\\?|&(amp;)?)bp_generatesefs=1: This parameter appears on index.php, don't know yet from where it comes

regex.(\\?|&(amp;)?)destination=node: This parameter appears on index.php, don't know yet from where it comes

regex.(\\?|&(amp;)?)_=\\d+: underscore variable followed by a figure

urls.info: The purge node will be used when the user will click on the Purge button i.e. automatically remove a maximum of 'innocent' lines from the Apache's logfile.  The idea is to restrict as much as possible the number of lines to suspecious lines only.  Remark : the url will first be simplified i.e. generic querystring parameter will be removed (see simplify_urls node).

regex.(\\.(7z|appcache|asf|avi|bak|bmp|css|cur: Remove URLs that points to static ressources (css, js, images, ...)

regex.(/component/tags/tag/[a-zA-Z-0-9-_]*)$: Joomla tags followed by an alias

regex.(/administrator/index\\.php\\?option=com: Joomla backend - Edit a specific article

regex..*(\\.(css|cur|gif|ico|jpg|jpeg|js|log|p: Access to a static file (based on file's extension)

regex..*\\.(eot|ttf|woff2?)\\?*.*$: Access to a webfont (with or without a querystring)

regex.^(.*/components/(content|komento|users)(: Access to a valid component; no subfolder no querystring

regex..*\\.((css|js)\\?v(ersion)?=?[\\d\\.]+)(: css or js static file followed by a version number (with or without a &sitepath=/ parameter)

regex..*(\\.(css|js)\\?[a-zA-Z\\d]+)$: Static css or js file followed by something like a token (only composed by numbers and letters) (f.i. *.css?v=f6ba7eb1a92b8e66)

regex..*\\.((css|js)\\?v=[a-zA-Z\\d]+)$: Static css or js followed by a version number composed of letters and/or figures

regex..*(/components?/mailto/(\\?|&(amp;)?)lin: Mail to component (share article with a friend)

regex..*(/components?/mailto/?(\\?|&(amp;)?)li: Mail to component (share article with a friend)

regex.^(/aesecure/json\\.php\\?task=(dashconfi: aeSecure remote site - Get latest version

regex..*(/aesecure/setup\\.php\\?[a-zA-Z-\\d]+: aeSecure page with key and, optionnal, an action (&w) and a tab (&t)

regex.(/administrator/index\\.php\\?option=com: Joomla com_jce in the Backend, followed by a token or not

regex.^(.*\\?option=com_komento)$: This url is generated by Komento on each page displayed by the site.

regex.^(/_?demo/aesecure/setup\\.php\\?&?(w=\\: aeSecure demo interface with the action number and/or the language and, an optional &_ parameter
aeSecure demo interface with the action number, the 'a' or 't' parameter and, an optional 'undefined' paramter, an optional &_ parameter

urls.info: Remove the max lines, even if we known that theses requests are attacks.

regex.(.*\\.(asp|aspx|ashx|cgi|exe|jsp)(\\?.*): No chance that these URLs can be fired on an Apache server, with or without parameters

ignore.info: These urls won't be processed at all. This will speed up the process by removing unnecessary processing.

skip.remoteHost_info: List of valid bots, connections made by these bots will be reputed safe and won't appear anymore in the 'Lines to analyze' part
skip.status_info: Entries with the HTTP status code mentionned here below won't be mentionned in the 'Lines to analyze' part

userAgent.info: Any connections from these userAgent are safe

regex.^(/?((fr|en)/)?\\?option=com_komento)$/: POST method on /?option=com_komento shouldn't be tracked in the MonitorPOST section

urls.info: Mention here the URLs that doesn't exists anymore on your site; they'll be skipped

regex.^/?(alpha_j30|lectures|livres|agathe-col: This root folder doesn't exists anymore

urls.info: Any request made on these urls will be monitored and the remote host who've made the connection will be reported

regex.(\\.(htaccess|htpasswd))(.)*$: Attempt to download an Apache configuration file

regex.^(/htdocs/)(.)*$: Attempt to access sensitve Apache folder

regex.(/(boot\\.ini|php\\.ini)).*$: Attempt to download Operating system file

regex.^(/(configuration\\.php|install\\.php|cr: Attempt to execute installation file, at the root level

regex.^(/(components|images|logs|modules|plugi: Attempt to execute a .php file stored directly in a subfolder like components or images.  There is no php script file in one of these folders.

regex..*(/xmlrpc(\\.php)?/?).*$: xmlrpc found in the url (filename or foldername)

regex..*(/com_extplorer/).*$: Try to get to accessd to the exTplorer interface (if not done by the site's admin, it's surelly an exploit attempt)

regex.(/admin\\.php(\\?)*(.)*)$: The admin.php doesn't script exists on a Joomla! website

regex.^(/(cache|libraries|logs|tmp)/)(.)*\\.ph: Access to restrictive folders and attempt to execute a php script

regex./(wp-(login|trackback)\\.php).*$: This script doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(/wp-content/(.)*)$: wp-content folder doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex..*(/(backup|web|www|wwwroot)\\.(gz|tar\\: Tentative to access a backup file

regex..*(\\.(bak|config|rar|sql|ini|log|sh|inc: Tentative to access a specific file extension

regex.^(/(wordpress|wp-admin|wp-includes|wp-up: This folder doesn't exists on a Joomla! site

urls.info: Any connections on these URLs (full, left, right, part) are bad because, f.i., these pages doesn't exists on the site.  These requests will be reported in the 'Possible attacks' part

regex.(/admin\\.php(\\?)*(.)*)$: The [@FOUND@] script doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(\\.(htaccess|htpasswd))(.)*$: Attempt to download an Apache configuration file [@FOUND@]

regex..*(\\\\).*: The presence of a \ character denotes an specific encoding and, perhaps, an attempt to obfuscate the real url

regex.(/ali\\.txt)$: The presence of @FOUND@ is a symptom of a successfull hack

Attempt to append/include php code into PHP.ini by the use of illegal statements

regex.\\(boot\\.ini.*)$: Attempt to download Operating system file [@FOUND@]

regex.^(/config\\.php)$: The [@FOUND@] file doesn't exists on a Joomla! installation

regex..*(/(register|signup|uu)\\.php)$: The [@FOUND@] script doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(^/components/com_content/article\\.php\: The [@FOUND@] script doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(^/components/com_content/views/article/: The [@FOUND@] script doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(^/components/com_userprofiles/userprofi: The [@FOUND@] script doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(/(components|images|logs|modules|plugin: Attempt to execute a .php file stored directly in a subfolder like components or images.  There is no php script file in one of these folders.

regex.(^/administrator/components/com_banners/: The [@FOUND@] script doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex./(wp-(login|trackback)\\.php).*$: The [@FOUND@] script doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex..*(/admin-profile).*$/: No [@FOUND@] page on a Joomla! website

regex.^(/administrator/components.*/.*\\.php.*: Direct access to a php script located on the backend ([@FOUND@])

regex.(/tmp-upload-images/){1}(.)*$: A lot of hack attempts tries to exploit the [@FOUND@] folder

regex.(/wp-content/(.)*)$: [@FOUND@] folder doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(\\+Result:).*$: Querystring attack, [@FOUND@] shouldn't be found in an url

regex..*\\?(.*http%3A%2F%2F).*$: The characters 'http://' have been used in the querystring, can be a XSS attack or SPAM

regex.(.*'')$: Attempt SQL Injection, url ending by a double single quote

regex.^(/(admin|_*backups?|bitrix|bkp|boards?|: The [@FOUND@] root folder doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(/stories/.*\\.php(\\?)*(.)*)$: php execution in the /stories/ folder is prohibited

regex.(\\.(gif|png|jpe?g|php)\\?rf){1}$: A lot of hacking [@FOUND@] script are called with the ?rf parameter

regex.(\\.(ash?x|asp|aspx|phtml?){1}(\\?(.)*)*: The presence of the [@FOUND@] file's extension denotes a possible hack attempt

regex.(/php-ofc-library/){1}: A lot of attacks are trying to exploit the [@FOUND@] standard php library that is included in some components

regex..*(/php(t|T)humb/php(t|T)humb\\.php).*$: A lot of attacks are trying to exploit the [@FOUND@] standard php script

regex.(option=com_jce&task=plugin&plugin=imgma: JCE upload attempt --> see http status, if 200 the upload was succeeded

regex./(components/com_weblinks/views/retentiv: The [@FOUND@] file doesn't exists on a standard Joomla installation

regex./(modules/mod_login/cache\\.php)$: The [@FOUND@] file doesn't exists on a standard Joomla installation

regex..*(/backup\\.(tar\\.gz|zip))$: Tentative to access a backup file ([@FOUND@])

regex..*(\\.(bak|config|sql|ini|log|sh|inc|dis: Tentative to access a specific file extension ([@FOUND@])

regex..*(/site/INSTALL)$: [@FOUND@] doesn't exists on a Joomla! website

regex.(data:image/.*;base64): 'data:image' followed by ';base64' in the url (for instance /templates/data:image/gif;base64,xxxxxxxxx)

regex.(&amp;sa=.*&amp;(ei|ved|usg){1}=): Presence of a &sa= parameter and with a second parameter in (ei, ved or usg)

regex.(%3Cscript%3|function\\(|html\\(): XSS attack, presence of a script tag or a js function in the url

regex..*sexycontactform.*/files/.*\\.php: Sexy Contact Form - Exploit of a php uploaded script (video tutorial : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X60WjQJBDdo)

components.info: Mention here components, modules, plugins, templates, ... that are not installed on the site.  Requests to one of these components will be reported in the hack attempt section

regex./(com_alphauserpoints|com_artforms|com_b: Call to a Joomla [@FOUND@] component identified, possible hack attempt if this component isn't installed on your site : somebody tries to exploit a known security hole in that component

regex./(mod_acepolls|mod_araticlhess|mod_fxpre: Call to a module [@FOUND@] identified, possible hack attempt

remoteHost.info: Any connections from these host are bad because they've been flagged as bad host, attacks have been started from them. All requests made from these host will be reported in the 'Possible attacks' part

userAgent.info: Any connections from these userAgent are bad because they've been flagged as bad host, attacks have been started from them. All requests made from these host will be reported in the 'Possible attacks' part

regex.^(WhatWeb/0.4.8-dev)$: WhatWeb/0.4.8-dev scan websites and tries to extract informations about the CMS, version number, emails, ...
